source: Care During Pregnancy and Childbirth Training Manual for CHO at AB-HWC
text:
∙ Divide the lower abdomen (below the umbilicus) into three parts, with two equidistant lines between the 
symphysis pubis and the umbilicus.
 ∙ Similarly, divide the upper abdomen into three parts, again with two imaginary equidistant lines, between the 
umbilicus and the xiphisternum.

24
 ∙ Keep the ulnar border of curved left hand on woman’s abdomen parallel to symphysis pubis. Start from
